PARAGRAPH.STRING: (also, and perhaps more properly, called Cerro La Negra) is a companion peak of Mexico's highest mountain, the Pico de Orizaba. At 4640 m above sea level (depending on which source one consults)
is one of Mexico's highest peaks, perhaps even the fourth highest. However, because
is not as well known as, for instance, the slightly lower Matlalcueitl, and
is often not included in lists of Mexico's mountains.

The name Sierra Negra is confusing, because a 'Sierra' is usually a mountain range rather than a single peak, and there is a Sierra often called the Sierra Negra which lies to the south of
, along the border of the states of Puebla and Veracruz. However, it is the name that occurs on the official INEGI maps and is the one that is most commonly used by English speakers to refer to
Istaktepetl ikni 'The Brother (or Sister) of the White Mountain' (the Pico de Orizaba being, of course, the White Mountain).
